docs.text: BestPairsFinder Given an even number of particles, this module is able to find groups of the closest possible pairs. The goal of this implementation is to solve for the global minimum of the summed distance in between particle pairs for 100 particles in fewer than 30 seconds. Example This is an example for 6 particles in 2 dimensions using the greedy graph approach (recommennded). from pairfinder.src.best_pairs_finder import BestPairsFinder finder = BestPairsFinder() particle_positions = [(1, 2), (1, 3), (1, 4), (2, 3), (2, 4), (3, 4)] pairing = finder.find_best_pairs(particle_positions, method='greedy') Methods There are three different method options for finding the optimal pairing: Enumerate (brute force) Greedy (using a graph-based approach) Monte Carlo (using a stochastic approach) The enumerate option scales poorly and is not recommned for 14+ particles.
